text: hi folks i'm bob strachan and i'm a
principal solutions architect here at
aws
today i'm going to show you a demo of
amazon transcribe and specifically a
feature called vocabulary filtering
amazon transcribe is an automatic speech
recognition service that can be used
when you have audio and video that
contains speech that you want to convert
to text it supports over 30 languages it
supports batch mode where you transcribe
pre-recorded files or real time where
the audio stream is transcribed as it's
being produced
if your speech might contain unwanted
words then you'll want to use a
vocabulary filtering feature for example
you can use vocabulary filters to
automatically remove profane words from
the transcription results for content
moderation or for generating family
friendly captions
in the demo i'll customize transcribe to
mask swear words that i recently
encountered in literature written by an
english author william shakespeare some
of you might be familiar with his work
here's the swear words i'm referring to
there's a lot of them
and my apologies if you were hoping to
hear me use actual swear words in the
demo i'm not planning to do that unless
the demo goes suddenly wrong and i do it
inadvertently i'll try not to though
instead let's pretend that the word
swear is a swear word and i'll show you
how to mask it out
so i've logged into my aws account and
opened up the amazon transcribe console
we'll do a real-time transcription here
without any vocabulary filtering just to
illustrate the starting position here
lydia i swear by the sacred moon
above don't swear by the moon the moon
is always changing
what should i swear by
don't swear at all but if you have to
swear swear by your wonderful self and
then i'll believe you
so you can see here we've got a full
transcript including swear words
so let's create a vocabulary filter now
and see if we can get rid of our swear
words it's very easy to do this we just
create a text file with a list of the
words that we want
to have redacted
well that put in our swear word here and
let's also redact the word moon while
we're at it just in case that's
offensive to anybody
so we'll go ahead and save this file
it's just got two words on two lines
let's save it let's go back to our
transcribe console and we'll click on
vocabulary filtering here
and i can just leave that page
and we'll create vocabulary filter
i can give it a name let's call it bob's
filter
we'll upload the file from my local
computer i could have put the file on s3
but we'll just upload it locally
here's the file that we just created in
our text editor we'll select it
we'll scroll down and do create
vocabulary filter
so let's see how our new filter works
let's go back to real-time transcription
go down to content removal settings and
enable our vocabulary filter
also some options here as to how to
apply the vocabulary filter we can mask
the occurrence of any of the words that
are in our filter list with three little
asterisks we can just remove them all
together so you wouldn't even know they
were there
or you can tag them which means you get
to see them in the transcription but
they're also tagged in the responses
coming back so you can process them with
your own code after the fact but for now
let's just go ahead and mask the
vocabulary
and we'll try running a transcription
again
lady i swear by the sacred moon above
don't swear by the moon
the moon is always changing
what should i swear by
don't swear at all but if you have to
swear swear by your wonderful self and
then i'll believe you
and now look at the transcription
there are no swear words
and the word moon has also been redacted
because we added that to our our filter
list and any occurrences of any of those
words have been masked with the three
little asterisk symbols
of course you can also use vocabulary
filtering for your batch transcription
jobs
i made an audio recording of my
shakespeare performance and put it into
an s3 bucket
we can go to transcribe do create job
give the job a name
specify the path to my recording
scroll on down hit next and here's where
i get to specify vocabulary filtering
and i can use the same filter that i
used for my streaming demo earlier and i
can also choose which of the methods i
want to use to apply the filtering
i've actually run a couple of jobs
already so let me show you quickly
here's the one where i masked my swear
words i can scroll down i can see
the same little asterisks as i saw in
the earlier demo
and here's the one where i tag the words
you can see here the words are still
part of the transcript but they're
emphasized with italics if i were to
download the json transcript um you
could see that each of the words appear
in my vocab filter are tagged
specifically and this allows you to
write application code to process the
transcript yourself based on which words
are tagged this would allow you to
create like an unredacted transcription
for certain users a redacted
transcription for others or from the
same transcription job
and that ladies and gentlemen is the end
of our show i hope you found it useful
and you're inspired now to try out
amazon transcribe for your own
speech-to-text needs
there's a lot more information in the
documentation on vocabulary filtering
and all the other features of amazon
transcribe until next time goodbye
